p: In contrast, infection during pregnancy has been associated with fetal microcephaly and a number of other congenital illnesses including visual deficits, hearing disorders, neural calcifications, learning disabilities, and arthrogryposis that may affect as many as 30% children born to mothers infected during pregnancy [ 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21]. Additionally, Zika can directly invade the placenta and has been associated with prolonged maternal viremia [ 22, 23, 24].
